{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = |image1_size = |caption = |caption2 = |pp = |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = AzureWave_AW-NE773 |wikipedia = |brand = AzureWave |model = AW-NE773 |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = May 23, 2011 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/AzureWave_AW-NE773 |sernum = |wlclass = AN600 |series = |if = Mini PCIe |if_bus_version = |ifconnector = |formfactor = (half) |vendor_id = 168c |device_id = 002a |subvendor_id = 1a3b |subdevice_id = 1081 |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = PPD-AR5BHB92 |icid = |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = 00:25:D3, 48:5D:60 |chip1 = Atheros;AR9280; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = U.FL |antenna = |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |802.11n = 300/300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = 2.4/5GHz Front End Module;Skyworks;SE2593A20;SiGe, 2593A20, 033EQHF;2; |flags = |802dot11_protocols = abgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 03/20/2008 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== This is a dual-band device, and as is typical of Atheros retail units, examples seen all appear to have a World Roaming regulatory domain code set in the EEPROM. This device is used in the Chrome CR-48 notebook (''Chromebook''). :[http://www.techrepublic.com/photos/google-cr-48-chrome-notebook-teardown/490945?seq=58&tag=thumbnail-view-selector;get-photo-roto Pictures from a CR-48 teardown] ===lspci -nnv dump=== 
05:00.0 Network controller [0280]: Qualcomm Atheros AR928X Wireless Network Adapter (PCI-Express) [168c:002a] (rev 01)
        Subsystem: AzureWave AW-NE773 802.11abgn Wireless Half-size Mini PCIe Card [AR9280] [1a3b:1081]
        Physical Slot: 1
        Flags: fast devsel, IRQ 19
        Memory at f1d00000 (64-bit, non-prefetchable) [disabled] [size=64K]
        Capabilities: [40] Power Management version 2
        Capabilities: [50] MSI: Enable- Count=1/1 Maskable- 64bit-
        Capabilities: [60] Express Legacy Endpoint, MSI 00
        Capabilities: [90] MSI-X: Enable- Count=1 Masked-
        Capabilities: [100] Advanced Error Reporting
        Capabilities: [140] Virtual Channel
        Capabilities: [160] Device Serial Number 00-00-00-00-00-00-00-00
        Kernel driver in use: ath9k
===dmesg output=== 
pci 0000:05:00.0: [168c:002a] type 00 class 0x028000
pci 0000:05:00.0: reg 0x10: [mem 0x00000000-0x0000ffff 64bit]
pci 0000:05:00.0: supports D1
pci 0000:05:00.0: PME# supported from D0 D1 D3hot
pci 0000:05:00.0: BAR 0: assigned [mem 0xf1d00000-0xf1d0ffff 64bit]
pci 0000:05:00.0: no hotplug settings from platform
ath9k 0000:05:00.0: enabling device (0000 -> 0002)
ath: EEPROM regdomain: 0x60
ath: EEPROM indicates we should expect a direct regpair map
ath: Country alpha2 being used: 00
ath: Regpair used: 0x60
ieee80211 phy3: Selected rate control algorithm 'minstrel_ht'
ieee80211 phy3: Atheros AR9280 Rev:2 mem=0xffffc90007be0000, irq=19
===cat /sys/kernel/ieee80211/phyX/ath9k/base_eeprom=== 
mTOR ath9k # cat base_eeprom 
       Major Version :         14
       Minor Version :         16
            Checksum :      11280
              Length :       3256
          RegDomain1 :         96
          RegDomain2 :         31
             TX Mask :          3
             RX Mask :          3
          Allow 5GHz :          1
          Allow 2GHz :          1
   Disable 2GHz HT20 :          0
   Disable 2GHz HT40 :          0
   Disable 5Ghz HT20 :          0
   Disable 5Ghz HT40 :          0
          Big Endian :          0
   Cal Bin Major Ver :          0
   Cal Bin Minor Ver :          7
       Cal Bin Build :         13
 OpenLoop Power Ctrl :          0
          MacAddress : 48:5d:60:xx:xx:xx
===RF Power=== 
802.11a: 12 dBm at 54 Mbps / 17dBm at 6Mbps +/- 1 dBm
802.11b: 18 dBm at all rates +/- 1 dBm
802.11g: 15 dBm at 54Mbps / 17dBm at 6Mbps +/- 1 dBm
802.11n 5G HT20 : 9 dBm at MCS15 / 17dBm at MCS0 +/- 1 dBm
802.11n 5G HT40 : 9 dBm at MCS15 / 17dBm at MCS0 +/- 1 dBm
802.11n 2.4G HT20 : 10 dBm at MCS15 / 17dBm at MCS0 +/- 1 dBm
802.11n 2.4G HT40 : 9 dBm at MCS15 / 17dBm at MCS0 +/- 1 dBm
===RF Sensitivity=== 
802.11a: -67 dBm
802.11b: -78 dBm
802.11g: -67 dBm
802.11n: -67 dBm at HT20 MCS15 / -64 dBm at HT40 MCS15
